placesVisited: Praslin, Vallee de Mai, Anse Lazio, La Digue, Mahe, Beachcombing, snorkelling, Creole culture
generalInfo:
Enjoy an invigorating take on one of the world’s most idyllic holiday destinations, with this Seychelles island hopping holiday. Spend two blissful weeks exploring the islands of Praslin, La Digue, and Mahe, with a car and personal driver at your disposal, meeting up with local guides who will show you new sides to this beautiful East African archipelago.

The Seychelles are rightly famed for their stunning beaches, but there is much more to a holiday here than simply feeling the sand between your toes. You can spend a day cycling leisurely around La Digue, admiring not only the famous granite boulders on the west coast, but also its old Creole architecture, the coconut factory, and sleepy fishing villages.

Spend a morning on Mahe wandering the markets of Victoria, the capital. You might pick up some fresh fruit for a picnic lunch, ready for your afternoon drive along the coast.

At the heart of this holiday is the opportunity to explore Seychelles culture. You’re not just spending two weeks in a resort, but really getting to know the islands, the people, and their ways of life. One of the best ways to do that is to eat in local restaurants, and of course your guides will have plenty of useful recommendations!

dayInfo.description: Today you will fly to Seychelles.

Welcome to tropical paradise. You will be welcomed & greeted by our representative on arrival at the Waiting Area of Mahe International Airport. You will be transferred to domestic terminal ( 5 Minutes walk). You will take short, 20 minutes flight to Praslin Island. Hotel on Breakfast basis.

Full days of leisure or discover the local area or snorkelling Day 4 - This day is devoted to Vallée de Mai – Praslin, best known for its Vallee de Mai, a World Heritage Site re-known for its provocative shape nut and mystic powers. Praslin is also famous for its Black Parrot which is unique to the island. Early breakfast, transfer to the Vallee de Mai Nature reserve, an extraordinary primeval forest, home to some 7,000 Coco de Mer palms and the rare Black Parrot. Drive along the coastal road past picture postcard coves and fishing villages to Cote d’Or where you can buy souvenirs if you like to. Afterwards you will visit one the most magnificent beaches in the world: Anse Lazio, where magnificent boulders grace silver sand slapped by clear turquoise waters – the perfect spot for a refreshing dip or just a lazy, tropical afernoon. Hotel on Breakfast basis.

In the morning you will be transferred to Praslin Jetty. You will travel by ferry to La Digue Island. Ferry duration is 15 minutes. Upon arrival you will be transferred to your hotel. Travel time 20 minutes. Hotel on Breakfast basis.

Full days of leisure or snorkelling. La Digue Island, one of Seychelles' most stunning granitic island – perhaps the most photographed in the world! With its stunning beaches and gigantic boulders cascading down the sea, La Digue is an experience not to be missed. The journey begins with a leisurely cruise across the channel that separates Praslin and La Digue Islands. Upon arrival at the picturesque La Passe harbouryou will recive a briefing on the places. Best way to discover this small island to hire bicycle from the hotel. This mode of transport is ideal for you to discover the island at your own leisurely pace. As you pedal along, look out for the stunning Creole architecture, the coconut factory and other interesting sites all vivid reminders of the lifestyle of a bygone era. Hotel on Breakfast

After breakfast you will take a ferry to the big island of Mahe. Arrival in Mahe and you will be transfer to your hotel. Travel time an hour along the scenic road. The island of Mahe's jungle clad mountains rise from the Indian Ocean. With over 60 beautiful beaches and coves fringing the island, ranging from sweeping bays of white sand to hidden corners you can make your own, a densely forested interior and small towns with a unique Creole culture, there is much to explore. The joy of Mahe is the variety the island offers: yes, more beach hopping than you could possibly squeeze into a two week holiday, but also waterfalls, jungle, mountain walks and stunning viewpoints, with a whole host of activities from rock climbing to sea kayaking and scuba diving. The beaches are wonderful and many are on a par with those found on Praslin and La Digue, but if you like to mix your beach break with exploration and adventure Mahe is a delight to drive around and find your own corner. Hotel on Breakfast & Dinner

Full day at leisure Optional: Mahe Island Tour - Begin with a tour of the capital, Victoria, and the picturesque charms of its ancient clock tower and colourful market, while our guides recount for you the history of the islands. After the market tour they will enchant you with tales of folklore as you journey on to the enchanting old Mission Lodge byway of a winding mountain road, where breath taking panoramas of rambling tropical vegetation, towering granite peaks and the azure ocean await. Travel on for a delicate Creole lunch prepared from our succulent local fruits and vegetables. End your day in the traditional ambiance of the Village where an inviting collection of arts and tropical wares are created. Hotel on Breakfast & Dinner
Today you will check out and say good bye to Seychelles. You will travel to the airport to fly back home.
Today you will arrive back home
